abstract: Th evolution of consumer behavior affected the decision for a takeover bid by Coca-Cola last week.
snippet: Th evolution of consumer behavior affected the decision for a takeover bid by Coca-Cola last week.
lead_paragraph: The chief executive of Coca-Cola, Muhtar Kent, threw cold water on its archrival PepsiCo’s decision to acquire its bottling subsidiary last year. So it came as some surprise this week to see Coke copying the transaction, with a takeover bid of about $13 billion announced for Coca-Cola Enterprises’ North American bottling operations.

headline.main: Coke Adopts a Move It Scorned
headline.print_headline: Coke Adopts a Move It Scorned

abstract: The $13 billion transaction strengthens the link between the soft-drink maker and its bottling operations.
snippet: The $13 billion transaction strengthens the link between the soft-drink maker and its bottling operations.
lead_paragraph: The Coca-Cola Company confirmed on Thursday that it had agreed to acquire the North American operations of its largest bottler.

headline.main: Coke Confirms Purchase of a Bottling Unit
headline.print_headline: Coke Confirms Purchase of a Bottling Unit

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: Coca-Cola’s decision to acquire its bottling subsidiary is an about-face the for the company, but it doesn’t mean the decision is not financially and strategically sound, Breakingviews says.
snippet: Coca-Cola’s decision to acquire its bottling subsidiary is an about-face the for the company, but it doesn’t mean the decision is not financially and strategically sound, Breakingviews says.
lead_paragraph: The chief executive of Coca-Cola, Muhtar Kent, threw cold water on its archrival PepsiCo’s decision to acquire its bottling subsidiary last year. So it came as some surprise this week to see Coke copying the transaction, with a takeover bid of about $13 billion announced for Coca-Cola Enterprises’ North American bottling operations, Reuters Breakingviews says.

headline.main: Coke Adopts a Move It Scorned
